BUEOhd08UMHDoq9j2HPbtQ.text: Wallked past here and looked great, went in for breakfast and absolutely brilliant no trouble squeezing in the five of us, will defiantly come again, food was out of this world and service was brilliant. Value for money and plenty of food.

L0Jj7AAE7H3jqpolfRO3-A.text: Waiting for a bus and want to get out of the rain? Looking for a good cheap glass of wine while you wait? Then this is the place for you! I came in after walking by this place for the millionth time , after deciding that I had some time to kill and I wanted some wine . Very nice interior and enjoyed the vibes it puts off. I could sit in a little nook and enjoy some vino while I read or people watched. The interior is very open and I feel like to me sophisticated. Loved the service and the wine I had was excellent ! I will be coming back for food and this review will be updated!

yPOZYrTAiGrBexCqnGDwDA.text: We really enjoyed this restaurant! The food was very good. I ordered the turkey hot dog and it was delicious! They also have a fun selection of cocktails. The atmosphere is relaxed and the decor is really unique.

cjdzstbNrGfQ9GwTNlwRxA.text: I didn't understand the cocktail menu so opted for the classic & sophisticated French martini !!

7fYghvz4l8ub0_mhhg7OiA.text: Good food, nice atmosphere but disappointing service. The staff seemed to go out of their way not to look at the patrons. If they improve the service it would rate higher

7kd4xY1o1c62ccK1ipU0KA.text: Very attractive, comfortable restaurant.  We had lunch, curried parsley soup and a Buttermilk fried chicken sandwich with red cabbage/jalapeno slaw.  Excellent.  Prices are good.  Right next door to our hotel, the Waldorf Astoria Caledonian, which probably would charge more than double for a sandwich.  Free WiFi.  Friendly good service.

DxWkDxl-0LydTBB5-9TDnA.text: Very loud and the service is awful. I went there as it was close to my hotel and was seated on the first floor by a waiter who said he'd be back-he wasn't. Ten minutes later a woman came by and took my order. After 3 countries in 5 days I was ready for some alcohol. Not to be. I waited another 10-15 minutes and got nothing. Called the waitress over who explained the bar was a little backed up. Said cancel the mixed drink and just get me a coke-Nothing again. Finally I barked at her to get me something, anything to drink. I then ordered my food (burger plain, medium rare) and received a burger with lettuce and tomato on it. She forgot to order it plain. Stay away.

jQ8Or41jLPzouA4pyTNZ9Q.text: Great location, great ambience, lovely staff, excellent location where you can see the castle, inside/outside seating and good food. What more can you ask for!!  We had the house prosecco which was really reasonably priced and absolutely scrumptious. The thing that impressed me most was the food. I had the BBQ beef brisket, cheese and black pudding sandwich. Oh my goodness. I am a massive fan of the slow cooked meats thing that is happening right now and this was probably the best thing I've tasted in this genre. No too sweet or sloppy. The black pudding added a lovely umami undertone to the sandwich and then gooey cheese on top in a round panini bun! Noooooooooom!!!!   I highly recommend this place and they even give you lollys with the bill!!!!!

00J5sIrl4PIN617wy4ZwDA.text: This is in a brilliant location and offers comfortable seating and a very comfortable space. The menu is a pretty simple American diner style offering and the staff are a very warm and friendly bunch.  Definitely worth a visit for casual breakfast or lunch and not too expensive

m0IYc0zlDz7mfBgW47ujGQ.text: great place with a great burger. I was expecting a much more posh, up-tight and expensive place given the location but it was none of the above.  highly recommend in Edinburgh

krA48I5GmrO_ayGR7zM8WQ.text: My husband really, really, really love this bar. We loved it prior to it morphing into The Huxley and we'll probably love it when it morphs into something else in the future.  So, what do we really love about this bar? THE COCKTAILS and the decor and the live music but mostly THE COCKTAILS.  Yeah, all caps on that one.  The cocktails, oh, the cocktails. With handcrafted cocktails ranging in price from 6.50-8, you just can't go wrong. We have yet to find better value for money anywhere in Europe. Plus the drinks are fantastic. Like, super, super good.  I drank many Comfortably Plums. Oh, so, damn plummy and lovely.  My husband drank many Huxley Harpoons and Smooth Like a Brazillians. He loved both and I had a taste of his Huxley Harpoon and I almost left Comfortably Plum for Huxley Harpoon but I realized that I was just too comfortable with Comfortably Plum to ever leave her (or him). YUM.  The other great thing about this bar is that they have table service and I'd say the service is a touch about average. Sure, you have to do the "European I need something" wave every-now-and-again but whatever. They will come running over (thought note that service does fall a bit when they are busy). Basically, walk in, someone will greet you, take a seat, and someone will be over in a snappy-snap to take your order.  Last, the restrooms/bathroom/toilets/WCs at this place are top notch. If you are out sightseeing all day and need someone to relieve yourself and rehydrate (they also have a shiny big coffee machine behind the bar), then this place is for you.  OK, last, last, they have a live music sometimes. I'm not sure when but a musician was playing during one of our visits and he was lovely!

n-0PhdzOkAZ8JJTAzvfwTg.text: A random find while searching for a quick bite to eat. Cosy interior with views of the castle, the staff were very friendly and the food we ordered was lovely. My friend described her beef brisket sandwich with black pudding as one the of the best things she tasted. The prosecco on offer was excellent, dry, crisp and reasonably priced. Definitely worth a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of The Huxley - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Huxley classic burger

R2bFEPqhGs0LLgiDQzMtrw.text: I was very excited to try out The Huxley. The menu is divine. Unfortunately the reality wasnt quite so much.   We started with the fried panko crusted olives with an alioli dipping sauce. Not sure if this was more of a technical flaw but the olives used were just too meaty and large. Would have preferred the smaller olives. I didnt enjoy the dish so much.  Then we had burgers. The cheesburger and the Philly cheesesteak. First off the cheeseburger was dry. Not a fan of the two patties, who are they trying to copy? The Big Mac!? Not a good idea. Also the Philly Cheesesteak was not just that. It was a burger with peppers. Not really that exciting.   You can get better burgers elsewhere as far as I'm concerned.

rwYP91GxQy5Kr2yqKlLLKA.text: Very rarely have I been so conflicted about a place as I am with the Huxley.  The place has a nice feel, is well lit, decorated.....lots of interesting furnishings that you notice the longer you spend there. 15 for a bottle of prosecco too is always going to be a win for me.  Their food to read is interesting if a little "fryer centric", so this Sunday few frioends and our mums went for some prosecco and ordered a heap of their small plates to share.  Fish goujons - dry and under seasoned Panko olives - liiiiiiiike Wedges - liiiiiiiike Beef tacos - weirdly on top of a napkin that then stuck to the food Meat platter - tasty Chicken wings - RAW!!!! Yep raw chicken - for what is actually a good professional kitchen......unforgivable to me and yep im now suffering the consequences!  Sort it out Huxley!!!! When you do I might come back!!

8bAVv1WO4VaPfzu6aAybrw.text: Not bad, not bad at all...  I hadn't managed to get to this reincarnation of The Rutland (the hotel still has the name) yet, and when I had to organize a wee dinner to 'show off' some of Edinburgh (after being informed that it had to be in the city centre and to get there we had to see a fair bit of Edinburgh...yes, dinner has these stipulations!) I thought it's reasonably fancy looking surroundings but causal atmosphere would be ideal.  The Huxley seems to be cocktail bar meets hunting lodge, with some hipster sprinkled on top. I comes together quite well though our table had those flip up cinema seats which I couldn't get used to! There's a good bit of faux tartan and some nice couches and armchairs.   I admit I was surprised by just how casual the menu was. We started with haggis spring rolls, the sesame tuna and a cauliflower patty of some kind. Everything was delicious though the tuna stood out!   For mains we all had burgers, and wow! Everyone was impressed. The burgers are smaller than you find elsewhere, I could eat it one handed, but came with two burgers! And the meat and seasoning was fantastic. I have slowly managed to train myself not to deconstruct food over the years but the meat on these burgers was so amazing each element had to consumed alone. The bun was also wonderful, slightly sweet but not overly so. The chips were chips, but good'uns.  For dessert I had the peanut butter and jelly cheeseNOMNOMNOM....sorry, I just had a flashback of me devouring this perfect dessert, cheesecake was what I meant to say. My friend got a Knickerbocker Glory and I got to experience the childlike glee they invoke when you see one for the first time (I work with grown ups from other countries where they don't grow up begging their parents for knickerbocker glories after every meal).   The service was generally ok, though slow and a bit frazzled. I think they could use another person on the tables on a Wednesday night, especially at this time of year.  Overall I'll do my best Arnie impression....'I'll be back'.... There's drinks offers on throughout winter and if you sign up to their mailing list you get 30% of your bill. That's loads!

aExAP6QdtyGI39ZA8yFUVw.text: Ahhhh, the Huxley. The latest incantation of the pub at the corner of the West End. It continues in the tradition of its forbearers - distinctly average. It's all so well-engineered and presented that it loses any charm or interesting element.   They do decent cocktails, but I'm not a huge cocktail fan so it's a bit lost on me. They do a decent range of beers, but they all fall under the "Standard Life employee" price tag. I'd rather go to the Hanging Bat for a beer.   I haven't eaten here so can't comment on the food. The bathrooms have this weird little hole in the wall so you can see when blokes are washing their hands. Not sure how I feel about that oddity (bit creepy?).   However, it's handily placed for catching up with old friends and is ideal for the bus stop. So it has its merits. It's just fine. I think this place continues to endure because of its location.

vD1BCZpUn9uNdF31fT_lDw.text: This place has changed again, seriously? Being a frequent(ish) visitor to Edinburgh I find that this place is different every time I'm in town. I believe it has changed hands more times a parcel during a game of pass the parcel played by a group of hyperactive kids.  The Huxley is a fantastic looking place however, it's obvious that the owners have splashed out on some very tasteful furniture and decor. The staff were also very friendly, the bar well stocked and there was a nice selections of draught beers on offer. I also enjoyed the music, not too loud and added nicely to the vibe of the place.  Prices however are pretty steep, something which I'm sure the owners realise. You can tell they are after a certain type of clientele here, as you are greated at the door by a YAT (young attractive female).  Had a wee swatch at the food as it passed and it looked pretty tasty. Nice place for a wee upmarket drink if your in this neck of the woods.

KBSRpB8LuIXgVcEP-Gc5Hg.text: Delicious but small portions. It was probably one of the best but absolutely the smallest philly cheese steak sandwiches I had. Draught cola was about the same amount as a prosecco glass.

kJ5KYyTUFPd7yK3c9FKRQA.text: this review will be short and sweet (rather like the cocktail i had) as i was only in the huxley briefly for a pre-dinner drink.  my first reaction on walking in the door was a bit of astonishment as the place is completely different from the rutland bar that previously inhabited the location.  and completely different in a very excellent way!  gone are all the tall dark chairs and dark colours that made the bar well very dark.  instead there are softer colours with smaller normal sized chairs and a brightly white tiled war with the taps behind the bar.  there are also so cosy arm chairs but again remaining a normal size not the monster size ones that the rutland had.  the drinks menu is rather short, but i don't think this place is aiming to be an extensive cocktail bar as they have a fairly large selections of beers.  so much more a place to have a beer, which suits the menu of burgers and hot dogs.  however, the cocktail list does have a good choice and i went for the breakfast mojito while the boyfriend went for the full moon.  our drinks took a wee bit of time to arrive, but i watched the bartender making them fresh so it's nice to know that they take care when mixing up drinks and the taste shows their effort is worth it.  my mojito was a lovely twist on the original.  made with grapefruit juice limes and mint it was very fresh tasting.  i could actually see how this might compliment a breakfast haha!  my boyfriend's drink was quite nice as well the blue moon beer added a nice creamy touch while the bourbon gave it a good kick.  so first impressions are good and we've both decided we need to go back and try some of the food.  so look out for an update once i've sampled more of the menu :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Huxley - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cocktail of the moment the 3rd tea

GB-0ROwq0GYiqxiqDnYbrw.text: Great service, a variety of comfy seats (sofas, wooden chairs, arm chairs) and a good menu. Great location. Nice, semi-private room with floor to ceiling windows and a view of Edinburgh castle. Bottles of prosecco for 17 ain't bad. Dear god that peppercorn sauce that came with the fries was pure bliss. My only gripe is that the mac n cheese is in fact a pasta bake. Pedantic? Perhaps. But when I order mac and cheese I want creamy sauced mac and cheese goddamit, not pasta with stringy/oily cheese melted on top.

gXWQD4uZKiQ4fkjwMmnypw.text: HAGGIS HOTDOG! Decided on The Huxley after the place we attempted to initially find was closed on Sundays. Sad times and we were hungry!  But The Huxley was open Hurrah! As I've capitalised: HAGGIS HOTDOG! My first taste of haggis, it's not that bad, it actually tasted better than the BBQ dog, which was too sweet in my opinion. Also, I think they might have taken on the comments from other reviewers, because the HH came in a baguette and that was lovely.   I'm thinking I should've got something beef though, because of other reviews and also there's a cow model next to the entrance and one coming out of the balcony above it?

ti6k8xMqnzXgr7ogVCcBOA.text: We revisited 7 days later to see if the potato wedges were still as good - and everything was!  Same great service, same great wedges and plenty of seats available (for another Tuesday).  We also decided to sample more of the food menu.  Being coeliac I had fewer choices, but the waiters were really helpful (one has a mum who's coeliac so he knew his stuff).  I had the chilli cheese hot dog (with extra fries in lieu of the bun).  Excellent chilli (no kidney beans as that's not the proper way, apparently) served on the side because "Chef wanted to make it nice since there is no bread".  What a nice man!  Husband had the Huxley burger (no cheese).  He thought it reeeaaallllly good - just the right size, nice and juicy, with the bun an interesting, almost glazed thing rather than the usual flour/sesame atrocities that can be served in some places.  Plenty of fries for him, too.  For beer I stuck with a Kirin which is OK for me and when Husband said he wanted something different the waiter brought him two samples to try.  Nice touch.  So, we'll be going back again (and again!) to The Huxley.

CZyh9Uzp9WNdMNf94gsyVA.text: I had received an email earlier in the week from The Huxley about their opening and that they were promoting 25% off all food.  After a Saturday full of shopping I was exhausted and easily coerced my boyfriend into going out for a few drinks.  I remembered the email I had received and The Huxley was on our way home.  They have a pretty good selection of beers on draught and and interesting cocktail menu - cocktails range from 6-7. I was really impressed the the staff! They were all very friendly (especially after one of us spilled a drink and consequently broke a glass).  After a few drinks and seeing other people around us eating we decided to order burgers.  I had the burger with blue cheese and bacon while my partner had chilli/Mexican one. Oh god! That burger was amazing. It was a smaller serving than what other gastropubs in Edinburgh serve but there were two patties on this one (see the picture I added).  The burger was well seasoned and was perfectly cooked.  I was and still am really impressed!    Note that the 25% all food runs until the end of the week I believe - check their website!  Well worth a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of The Huxley - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

yHZ5Pu-aZB2lSF_Daf9FJg.text: The Huxley is new, but it seems to have got a lot of thing right compared to the former Rutland Bar. Located at the west end (beside all the never ending tram works) The Huxley has good beer and good banter and unlike the previous incarnation it doesn't become a ghost town after 8pm when the office workers head home.  The staff are friendly and fairly efficient, keeping the alcohol flowing and the tables clear of glassware. The hot dog I had was tasty, though the soup one of our party had looked to me to be on the small side.   The bar is nicely finished and as seems to be the trend the beer taps are fitted into the back wall, I used to find this odd as the staff have to turn their back on the patrons however it has the advantage of avoiding the crass plastic pumps that adorn most bars and seem to get bigger every year...  Overall then a good bar with decent beer and food alongside a good vibe, what is not to like.

4MKLFcSD5qwS5hGuO24GCA.text: Very pleased with the falafel sandwich (lovely spicy pickled cabbage on it) and my boyfriend with the chili cheese dog.  Perfect after a 4 hour train ride here!  Looks like they have a nice cocktail list as well but didn't try.

Mf6vJByrYpy2WmqHAYcgcQ.text: I've only been to the Huxley for drinks but in general I'm a fan of it. It's near the office which is a major boon for it for a start.  They've restructures the old rutland bar and made it a much more usable space. Whereas before it was all big chairs and awkwardly high stools. They now have a more usable bar space which looks good to hang out at. A good waiting area if you're waiting to meet someone - this is really good for meeting people for business meetings. Before you had to hover uncertainly among the diners.   I think that I have a slight issue with the fact that the beers could have been done better. They have a FEW good taps and a couple decent bottles but I think they could have done more. It's also rather expensive.  We had some olive things with a sort of sauce. These were excellent although my friend ate most of them (he had paid for them)   I will update once I've been once more and perhaps bought some food.

Sgdh8MHnxxxL938JwrTxqg.text: Maybe Hustlers, not Huxley?   So, similar to Jurgen's statements below, this place creates a conflict of emotions in my mind that gives me a pain right behind my right eyeball. I have been a couple times and I just feel that for all the effort they are putting in, they are missing the final touches that would make this a commendable establishment. I really enjoyed its previous incarnation and was genuinely excited when I heard about this new concept.  So their premise is sound, a relaxed quality establishment that serves good value US style food and quality beverages, with the appropriate level of service - which is expected. This venue has always been synonymous with quality, well thought out concepts - see Kyloe upstairs for an example of how to get it right every time.   My problem here is that it doesn't really do what it says on the tin. The food is fine, not great, and reasonably priced - a frustration when you know the quality produce that is getting pounded out left right and centre on the 1st floor. The wine list and cocktails are relatively accessible, but certainly not setting my world on fire. The beer selection is AVERAGE, they have something like 10 pumps, and nothing overly exciting that you can't get in the majority of new boozers in town, the same goes for their bottled range.  The service is the part that makes this a well below par joint, and I know that will come as a surprise to a lot of people. I am ok if you want your team to be super cool, with trendy beards and tattoos all over the place, Timberyard pull it off without any effort whatsoever. But you need to make sure that these guys understand the basics of service. For example, if I order a beer at the bar and am told to take a seat and somebody will bring it over, then I don't expect it to take over 10 minutes to come. I also expect seasoned bar tenders to be able to deal with more than one order at a time. If you are offering table service, then make sure I get checked back on, and maybe offer me another beer before this one runs out, it's basic service. Finally, if you tell me I am ok to run a tab then make sure the bill is correct at the end of the night, my most recent visit was borderline attempted theft as the sheer volume of rogue drinks and 'double entries' on a bill which should have been a couple bottles of wine and a handful of pints was arguably more than just human error.  Like I said, a good concept, poorly executed.

jw7cajweQx5nYN0LwRmLwA.text: My friends whole fish was delicious, and he shared a good amount. Cooked perfectly.   I ordered eggs on toast with smoked salmon. Egg poached to near perfection, and salmon was good too. We weren't hungry enough for a full Scottish breakfast, but the food was good enough for us to maybe return tomorrow morning.   Minor complaint: The smoked salmon was saltier than I am used too.....a LOT saltier. Still tasty, though

hwnsgXzAbPItVCh-PZui5w.text: Cute location and great ambiance, but food leaves a lot to be desired. Also, we arrived as the breakfast was ending and lunch hadn't started, and had to wait 20 minutes to order (and the restaurant was half empty!) Wings were in a tasty sauce but not crispy. Fish and chips were under-seasoned.

eH6AQrKTbbQjwQfxTvy8bA.text: The Huxley has a "hip" decor with a mix of sofas, high tables, and casual seating instead of the standard restaurant chairs (they still seat you like a normal restaurant however). Their burgers taste like a Big Mac if it was made with quality ingredients. The burger patty was fresh as were all of the toppings, and the side of fries is above average. I wish my burger was a bit more cooked (some pink in the centre) but other than that no complaints. Also tried the irn bru sofa for the first time which tastes like an orange creamsicle.

6uIXJgvrB3XC1cOKRM-UCw.text: My friend and I stumbled upon the Huxley on our way to doing some sightseeing and thought we would pop in and give it a try.   I had the eggs Benedict that were not very good in my opinion. It had a nice hollandaise sauce, but other than that the plate lacked flavours or any uniqueness. I had to return my first plate because the eggs were freezing cold- not the best start to a meal! My friend got the british breakfast and said it was very average. Unfortunately we had to wait such a long time because our meals came out at different times.   The staff were really awesome and accommodating throughout. They brought me a new eggs benny without hesitating as well as taking the coffees off our bill because of all the mix ups! They were also really apologetic which was nice.

fqDRWH80UbiweM1tgpR42w.text: This restaurant is great with fresh ingredients, consistently prepared.  Brunch was amazing with the perfect Eggs Benedict. I had the smashed avacado on toast with egg.   Delicious.  Another stop for lunch we had the burger.   Fresh beef, perfectly prepared.  Fries were fresh, hot and crispy.  I stopped for a late lunch and ordered the salmon salad.  Once again, they did not disappoint!  The salmon was fresh and cooked perfectly. I would eat here every day!!  It's that good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Huxley - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

AVeWm6mNsbvuEFLFMafkEg.text: Just got back to the hotel after a light supper and enjoyed it very much. The burgers were spot on, the service was friendly and fast, and the Huxley had a very nice atmosphere. The location is perfect and captures the lively heartbeat of this city. Oh, and the bacon was amazing!

1zLXeLHxRyfJmZ0yKGBQmw.text: I don't normally like to give bad reviews but when we arrived we just stood around for about 5-10 minutes.  When they finally seated us we waited 20 minutes to see if anyone would come over and ask for our drinks and noone arrived so... we just walked out.

h4plr1ey-XckF6VjzLxr6A.text: Wonderful place for breakfast. You can go healthy or in the other direction, but either way you will be happy. They make delicious smoothies, very flavorful and not just the juice. Fiber is important!    Their coffee is first rate, both espresso drinks and American. I sampled several egg dishes there over a number of visits, all good, but my favorite was a riff on eggs Benedict made with smoked salmon.  Good bread, too.   Service is lovely. If you stay at the Caledonian across the street, you should by all means come here for breakfast!

3h3KmmfsWS3a0xVFFq5nKg.text: It is a shame to have to knock off a star, but the Huxley has been quite disappointing as of late.  The service is really good. The food is very tasty.   My current issues is with the loudness of the bar. It doesn't matter where I stand/sit I have to shout to get myself heard.  The other thing is the tables, the wooden type barrel top tables are nice to look at, but when you lean on them with any kind of fabric, they get stuck to the table. I found this out with one of my favourite jumpers, some of it may still be part of that table.   I understand these tables are not easy to clean, but it happens to be really sticky and that can't be the idea behind this.   So for that 1 star off.

7GeHSfTdb3eI5051X3Xt6A.text: As our hotel didn't have a restaurant for breakfast we had to resort to exploring for somewhere to eat for breakfast. About a 10 minute walk from our hotel we noticed this lovely looking bar - they have a lot of smart and funky furniture including cow print chairs. It is very colourful inside - the benches are orange which adds a nice feel to the place. We ordered 2 full breakfasts which include tea or coffee. You get loads. The quality of the food was 1st class and would definitely recommend to try here for breakfast.  On our second day we was walking back to the Hotel and fancied a quick drink so decided to come back. Although serivce took a while for them to take our order we quickly received it once we had placed it. The beer was decent and seemed to be well kept. We tried the avocado wedges - deep fried avocado, which were excellent and something I have never seen before.

photos.caption: Photo of The Huxley - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Avocado wedges

YKMurdxd1kzEMXuzECc4ig.text: Me and my partner spotted this on are first day in edinburgh and thought we must go in as it looked lovely. The second day we needed somewere for breakfast as we didn't get any with the hotel so thought we would give it a go we order a Scottish breakfast with tea and fresh orange juice it was really nice and fresh. You got two different types of sausages, bacon tomato, mushroom, black pudding, haggis, toast and a potato cake.  The place was modern and traditional mixed together and the staff was really friendly.   We also went in for a drink it was lovely we sat in the window so we could watch the world go by. I had a vodka and coke and my partner had a beer we also shares some deep fried avocado which was unusual but really tasty.  I would recommend this bar it's a really great place will definitely be going again when I'm next in edinburgh

photos.caption: Photo of The Huxley - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Huxley - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Huxley - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

29PcH42vq1ljA-X8VZTNWg.text: Fanatic breakfast and selection! This place opens up at 8am. It's a very nice place and i can only share about my breakfast experience. I ordered a mocha which was delicious and sweet. For breakfast, my colleagues came along with me and ordered blueberry compote pancakes. I  got the porridge with blueberry compote and scrambled egg whites and smoked salmon with toast. The porridge is very tasty especially with the compote added. They don't have cinnamon powder. The smoked salmon and eggs were a good combo with the toast. The toast was very buttery though.  All was a very heart healthy breakfast. I wish the server a little more attentive to us. It took us a while to get her attention and to give us our check. They seem to take their sweet time and it wasn't that busy when they opened at 8am.

photos.caption: Photo of The Huxley - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mocha
Photo of The Huxley - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Porridge with blueberries
Photo of The Huxley - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Blueberry pancakes

KV42JahyVntdlncbNmDh3A.text: Came in after 10pm, 10 minutes before they stopped serving food. They were inviting & friendly to accommodate us. We had good beer and cocktails, a heavenly cup of soup with the most delicious bread on earth and Potato Skins (which were actually more like bite sized twice baked potatoes). Sooooo good!

hcTqO40a2bTMjpu9MtPZOQ.text: Enjoyed the chicken satay and nachos, service was a bit scrambled but thats because this place seemed pretty popular on a early Friday evening.

BNESLrEJaDCDhJMO0nUc2w.text: This is a beautiful space to pop in for a late brunch. The food (burgers and 2 different types of seasoned fries) were good, but most notably, they serve the coffee and real cream. If you don't know what real cream is, try it here.

bHCAjSm_VqLPPcmwKBGPqA.text: Had a couple drinks and their buffalo nachos. Tasty! Vibe is a mixed bag but cool. Feels like a chain but don't think it is. Clean and prompt service.

ZHSMXh3NLk2U-eq73BPNXg.text: Popped in for a quick coffee en route home from dinner elsewhere. Service was incredibly speedy, and coffees hit the spot.  After eyeing desserts at the next table we opted for a peanut butter chocolate brownie - DO IT! Brownie was deliciously fudgey but quite light at the same time, how they managed that I don't know. Salty chunks of peanut butter were heavenly.  After drinks & dinner in a busy bar, this place was just what we needed. Cosy, comfortable seating. Fantastic looking armchairs in the window which were unfortunately occupied. Great vibe. Will be back soon to check out the beer & cocktail selection.

XKEqyQxJn_FGpyxwEIYzZw.text: Out of the blue, The Rutland Bar suddenly became The Huxley. There was little warning or reason as to why. This is one of the closest bars to our office so 10 of us paid it a visit for lunch today after we were let down by The Hanging Bat.  It isn't vastly different to how it was when it was the Rutland but it is most definitely improved. We were all sitting in a comfy big booth out the way. We were surrounded by funny vintage signs for things such as 'nervous pills', which gave us plenty to look at whilst waiting for our food.  The menu is really interesting, there is a section of light bites which all sound delicious, such as haggis and a duck egg on toast with HP sauce. But I was starving and needed something more substantial and went for the Chicago hot dog. It was about 7 and was served with fries. They were nothing special but the hot dog was devine.   The staff were on top form, really friendly and keen to impress with the newly styled name and look. Overall, a definite improvement and i lovely place for a drink or bite to eat. Only thing is, they need to work on their promotion and their social media, customers are keen to talk so they should be open for some banter :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Huxley - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicago hot dog... Delicious!

91asCUo5b6T3ohyh6fNSxQ.text: Genuine waitstaff... Good greasy burger and fries... Great funky feeling!

OssOQ6x3Bs7cRPZAc5HPfw.text: The piggy is one of the best burgers I've ever eaten and the chips were really well seasoned. As an aside, the washroom was immaculate.

photos.caption: Photo of The Huxley - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pulled pork and bacon on a double burger
